articles.author: Manuela Lazic
articles.title: In ‘Maestro,’ Bradley Cooper Is Trying So Hard - The Ringer
articles.description: As the movie’s director and lead, Cooper has poured himself into it—but at some point all of the effort becomes noticeable, and all of Leonard Bernstein’s magic becomes lost
articles.content: In several respects, Leonard Bernstein was a man split in two. Dreaming of becoming the first great American conductor but finding more success as a composer for Broadway musicals, he also struggled … [+6659 chars]
